## Part 1: Fun with functions
```{r 1a, echo=TRUE}
Exp <- function(x, k) {
  sum <- 1
  while (k>=1){
    a <- x^(k)/factorial(k)
    k <- k-1
    sum <- sum + a
  }
  print(sum)
  }

##### Example 
x <-2
k <- 6
Exp(2,6)
```

```{r 1b, echo=TRUE}
sample_mean <- function(x) {
    sum <- 0
    for (i in seq_along(x)) {
      sum <- sum + x[i]
    }
    mean <- sum/i
    print(mean)
}

sample_sd <- function(x) {
   summ <- 0
  for (i in seq_along(x)) {
      summ <- summ + x[i]
    }
    mean <- summ/i
    
sumsd <- 0
    for (i in seq_along(x)) {
      sumsd <- sumsd + (x[i] - mean)^2
    }
    sd <- sqrt(sumsd/i)
    print(sd)
}

##### Example
z <- c(6, 7, 8, 11, 2, 1, -1)
sample_mean(z)
sample_sd(z)
```

```{r 1c, echo=TRUE}
calculate_CI <- function(x, conf) {
  #calculate mean
 summ <- 0
  for (i in seq_along(x)) {
      summ <- summ + x[i]
    }
    mean <- summ/i
  #calculate alpha
    a <- 1 - conf
  #calculate df
    df <- i-1
  #calculate t_score
    t_score <- qt(p = a/2, df = df, lower.tail = FALSE)
  #calculate the standard error
    SE <- sample_sd(x)/sqrt(i)
  #calculate CI
    upper <- mean + t_score * SE
    lower <- mean - t_score * SE
    CI <- c(lower,upper)
    print(CI, digits=4)
    print(paste0('confidence:',conf))
    print(paste0('df:',df))
}

##### Example
##### create a list of 100 numbers drawn from a standard normal distribution
ex_list <- rnorm(100)

##### calculates a 95% confidence interval for x
calculate_CI(ex_list,0.95)

##### calculates a 99% confidence interval for x
calculate_CI(ex_list,0.99)
```
